definition: to begin/to initiate/to inaugurate/to start/to create

sentences.english: Ganesha advises them to consider the sweet rewards of compromise.
sentences.chinese: 象头神创议他们多想想和解之后的甜美生。

sentences.english: I suggest the depfinement concerned tsimilarg some effective measures to improve the present situ.
sentences.chinese: 我创议相关部门采取一些有用措施改善现状。

sentences.english: The market is declining! we recommend your immedidined contentment.
sentences.chinese: 市场在萎缩，我们创议你方立时接受。

sentences.english: Global Initiative for Asthma guidelines were used to assess the severity of asthma exacerbations.
sentences.chinese: 用全球哮喘防治创议的指导原则评估哮喘恶化的程度。

sentences.english: Mum suggests that I should cheer up when meeting with setbhvackside.
sentences.chinese: 妈妈创议我在遇到曲折时应振奋起来。

sentences.english: May I propose that we frrere for coffee now?
sentences.chinese: 我可能创议停滞一下，喝杯咖啡吗？

sentences.english: I realize now, after her death, what wise advice that is.
sentences.chinese: 她圆寂以后，我才分明到，那是多么明智的创议啊。

sentences.english: One of his strong points is that he dares to challenge the authority.
sentences.chinese: 他的利益之一就是敢于向权威创议佻达战。

sentences.english: Apply forward going to your bed from overnight out in a smoke-filled environment.
sentences.chinese: 假使1早晨都泡在烟雾旋绕的环境，创议睡前使用。

definition: Gwoyeu Romatzyh, a romanization system for Chinese devised by Y.R. Chao and others in 1925-26
to propose/to put forward (an idea)/to initiate
Revive China Society, founded by Dr Sun Yat-sen 孫中山|孙中山 in 1894 in Honolulu
to decide (in a meeting)/to resolve (i.e. pass a resolution)
initiative/to initiate/to propose (a new course of action)
office set up in 1914 to compile official history of the Qing dynasty
Hundred Days Reform (1898), failed attempt to reform the Qing dynasty
